Labradors, Golden Retrievers, Shih Tzu, Poodles, Bernese Mountain dogs are best for first-timers because they are generally friendly, least likely for genetic reactivity, more eager to please, and more forgiving of rookie mistakes
Border Collies need 1-2 hours of mental stimulation daily - if you can't provide that, skip the breed
French Bulldogs are good for apartments because they're quiet, adaptable, and don't need much exercise
Giant breeds like Great Danes surprisingly do well in apartments because they're calm and low-energy indoors
Separation anxiety is the #1 reason dogs are returned - match energy/alone time tolerance to your life
Hip dysplasia in large breeds is expensive - expect $5,000-$10,000+ for surgical correction
Grooming costs for Poodles/Shih Tzus are hidden expenses - $60-$100 every 6-8 weeks adds up
Don't get a dog based on trends (Dalmatians after Disney movies, French Bulldogs after Instagram)
